data.title: Scroll view smoothing v2

I had to redo the branch pull request/ it continues on from

## 

I believe it's frame rate independant now, plus I fixed some other less obvious issues. I'm not sure how to do script exposures.

data.title: ListView : Selection fails
data.body:
Hello

I'm trying to set up a SubscribeToEvent for a ListView. A simple selection. I have been testing a basic selection which fails. I attempted to attach the SubscribeToEvent to the actual ListView, UIElement, and Text components and I do not get in event.  I am not sure if it's me or Urho3D. The menu is hard coded. I am posting the code on PasteBin.

http://pastebin.com/VYJKDBS0

Any thoughts? Currently if I move the most outside the ListView nothing is highlighted. Also, If I attempt to set one of the options. It does not highlight. The SubscribeToEvent doesn't run either.

Vivienne

data.title: Fix C4512 ("'class' : assignment operator could not be generated", MSVC warning level 4) compiler warnings that leak into applications using Urho.
data.body:
Fix C4512 ("'class' : assignment operator could not be generated", MSVC warning level 4) compiler warnings that leak into applications using Urho.

I would recommend moving to using level 4 instead of the level 3 that CMake uses by default as the default warning level on MSVC in order to catch many quite useful warnings (there will be lots of warnings...).

data.title: Completion of error handling
data.body:
I have looked at a few source files for your current software. I have noticed that some checks for return codes are missing.

Would you like to add more error handling for return values from functions like the following?
- [pthread_mutex_init](http://pubs.opengroup.org/onlinepubs/9699919799/functions/pthread_mutex_init.html) ⇒ [Condition constructor](https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/blob/f120aa4be00d95f98bddab26ea25c84052f68217/Source/Engine/Core/Condition.cpp#L58)
- [ftell](http://pubs.opengroup.org/onlinepubs/9699919799/functions/ftell.html) ⇒ [File::Open](https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/blob/f120aa4be00d95f98bddab26ea25c84052f68217/Source/Engine/IO/File.cpp#L118)

data.title: Use of angle brackets around file names for include statements
data.body: Would you like to [replace any double quotes](https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/blob/f3024b9f4be8ee5cc06fc99c635224e71672db60/Source/Engine/Core/Context.h#L25) by [angle brackets around file names for include statements](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/21593/what-is-the-difference-between-include-filename-and-include-filename)?

data.title: Complete quoting for parameters of some CMake commands
data.body:
Some parameters (like "[${PROJECT_BINARY_DIR}/Docs](https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/blob/de93f1731064b63e986d4c129c33c918dde0b2ce/Source/CMakeLists.txt#L205)" and "[${CMAKE_CURRENT_SOURCE_DIR}/Doxyfile](https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/blob/f120aa4be00d95f98bddab26ea25c84052f68217/Docs/CMakeLists.txt#L53)") are passed to CMake commands in your build scripts without enclosing them by quotation marks. I see that these places will result in build difficulties if the contents of the used variables will contain special characters like semicolons.

I would recommend to apply [advices from a wiki article](http://cmake.org/Wiki/CMake/Language_Syntax#CMake_splits_arguments_unless_you_use_quotation_marks_or_escapes.).

data.title: How to interpolate the bone with disabled animation to the ongoing animation?
data.body:
I have one bone which is disabled from animation for a certain time. After that time I set bone.animated=true; and this bone jumps immediately into the animation(which is in progress). Is there any way to join smoothly the disabled bone to the animation? I can do it manually with slerp but how to get the rotation which should be in this moment on bone with disabled animation?

Thanks.

data.title: Forum is down since 18 Sept morning
data.body: This is by far the longest outage we have experienced since we move to prophpbb.com. Their support forum (on the same domain) appears to be down too while there is no update on their Facebook support page. Any one knows what's going on?

data.title: Basic test code
Ui fix
data.body: Just a simple addition to add scrollview deceleration for a smoother experience on mobile devices.

data.title: RenderPath and material shaderParamaters won't accept vector and matrix (AngelScript)
data.body:
I'm trying to set RenderPath's shaderParamaters with:

``` c++
renderPath.shaderParameters["MyUniform"] = Vector3(0.1, 1.0, 0.5);
```

but it gives me error:

```
No matching signatures to 'RenderPath::set_shaderParametes(String, Vector3)'
```

It gives me similar error if I pass Matrix data, but it's okay if I pass only float data. 
Is this a bug?

data.title: Adjust RPATH on OSX binary packages for SHARED lib type
data.body: Currently the binary package (build artifact) from Travis-CI has RPATH still set to where the Urho3D dylib can be found using hard-coded path pointing to `/home/travis/build/urho3d/Urho3D/Lib`. So, in order to let executable to find the `.dylib` after unzipping the downloaded binary package, one would need to use `DYLIB_LIBRARY_PATH` environment variable to point to the actual location of the `.dylib` after unzipping, which is not nice.

data.title: Update the master branch's readme
data.body:
The build options in https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/blob/master/Readme.txt are outdated.
(+ http://urho3d.github.io/documentation/HEAD/_building.html)

I tough it was a good idea to let you know since most people(I guess) would grab the source and try to compile it based on the online guides.

Also, the source code that can be downloaded from the website has got already updated readme.

data.title: Support for loading single cubemap image
data.body:
Urho still only support cubemap with xml file referencing six images. It will be nice if Urho can recognize single cubemap image. I propose to still use xml for defining cubemap layout, maybe some kind like this:

``` xml
<cubemap>
    <layout name="horizontal|horizontalnvidia|horizontalcross|verticalcross|blender" />
</cubemap>
```

For layout name, choices are taken from http://www.cgtextures.com/content.php?action=tutorial&name=cubemaps and Blender layout one from http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Blender_3D:_Noob_to_Pro/Build_a_skybox

data.title: Variant::GetVoidPtr() never added
data.body:
This is sort of a continuation of this issue - https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/issues/196

I don't think you ever added the Variant::GetVoidPtr() method. Which I could really use right now! As I need to store an object that does not inherent from RefCounted. I'm sure I could just have it inherent from RefCounted but I would really like to be able to store a pointer to an object in a VariantMap.

data.title: UI should be percentage of screen based, and not absolute
data.body:
There are a few ways to do this (which I can discuss in detail if so desired), but this would help for resizing and multiple resolutions. 

I know the idea is to make different layouts for different resolutions, but this method would cut down on a LOT of that work.

data.title: Safely save scene server-side when clients are connected
data.body: Whats the best way of saving a scene, but making sure that none of the "temporary" objects like player nodes are saved? Could I just call RemoveChild on the scene (passing in the player node) then add it back in with AddChild after saving? Is this even safe to do?

data.title: Get VectorBuffer from Image
data.body: I don't see a way of doing this from within the scripting API

data.title: Added TileMap
Combining skinned models in the Editor
data.body:
In the Editor, when combining 2 skinned models sharing the same skeleton:
- if I remove the "master" (first one), it segfaults
- if I remove the second one, the skeleton (bone hierarchy) is also removed

Steps to reproduce:
- create a node with 2 AnimatedModel components (for example 2 Jacks or 2 Ninjas)
- remove the second one then the first one

data.title: Compression engine for scripting engine
data.body: It would be really nice if we had access to a compression engine from within our scripts (lzma for example).

data.title: Raycast inaccurate inside mesh
data.body: I have cave like mesh and the rocks and other objects are placed inside that mesh. When I  try to select some mesh which is inside the cave, there is difficulty of picking the right one - the mesh which is over the mouse pointer is ignored and the big cave mesh is selected instead quite often. The cave mesh has normals flipped inside.

data.title: A basic terrain editor that integrates with the Urho3d Editor. This is i...
data.body: ...n very early stages. It currently supports raising/lowering terrain, setting the height of the terrain, and smoothing the terrain (which needs some serious improvisation). This is all done using "Brushes", which you can create and edit (only the alpha of the brush affects the brushes effect on the terrain). Terrains are saved to the file they we're loaded from, and editing one will cause SetSceneModified to be called (therefore prompting you to save before exiting). This is WIP and should not be considered done by any means.

data.title: Multiple Terrain splatmaps/materials
data.body: Is there support for using more than 3 textures on a Terrain? I have a feeling this will require that the terrain is rendered more than once if you want to have more than just 3 (2 times if you want 6 textures, 3 times if you want 9 textures, etc.)

data.title: Mouse movement becomes chaotic after window resize (Windows 7)
data.body: Basically mouse movement becomes a lot faster than it should be after resizing the application window. This happens in the Editor too, so I know it can't just be my program.

data.title: Terrain Editor
MinGW CI build failed due to out of memory during linking phase for samples
data.body: The CI build process has been tweaked a number of times for MinGW platform. Currently the samples are built using just one worker process, so there are no more room to scale back. If there are no other way out then we are forced to exclude build test the samples or exclude 64-bit STATIC MinGW build from the build matrix all together, in order not to get false alarm.
